p: Aedes albopictus became widely known only over the last 50 years, when it was gradually discovered on all continents outside its native Asia and caused a chikungunya pandemic [ 10, 11, 35, 36]. A total of more than 40 viruses can be transmitted naturally or experimentally by Ae. albopictus [ 36]. Experimentally, it will take blood from many vertebrate species [ 37]. It also lives longer than Aedes aegypti [ 38]. Aedes albopictus therefore perfectly fulfils the necessary conditions in terms of biology and events to be an excellent vector of virus to humans.
